responses: Hello, thanks for visiting! how can I help you?
See you later, thanks for visiting! Come back again soon
Happy to help!

patterns: What all the features I can explore here?
What kinds of features are there?
What is the best thing here?
Tell me in brief what are the features available here
responses: This is the place where your created assets comes into live action
1. You could create as many customer records for multiple organizations
2. You can search for thousands of records by using our advance search system
3. You can import a file with huge data according to your need
4. You can make use of work flow inbox for approve/reject the events
5. You can create instances of your hierarchies for a better parent-child relationship view
6. You can check the status of all your running jobs
7. You can create reports and charts for your organization

patterns: What is the purpose of you here?
responses: In order to provide customer E2E guide with an aim to allow user to explore all possible features in BUI Apps
there is a need of an interactive chatbot which will guide the customers on how they can make use of all features, resolved some common frequently asked questions related to the product
so that they won't have to refer the documentation again and again and can continue their respective work just by interacting with me
Business model can be represented here as a Business Entity with require fields as per the Business requirement.

patterns: How to create a BE record ?
responses: Record is an instance of Business Entity providing the values for fields defined in the Business Entity.
Follow the below steps for your understanding:
You can create a record by clicking on the New icon on top left side panel
Select your Organization and hit create button
Provide the required values and submit!

patterns: What is Search icon text box?
How to search for a record?
responses: User can search for the different records for Business Entities defined in the Organization.
We use Facets so that user can do a advanced search based on attribute value level defined for the Business Entities
Follow the below steps for your understanding:
1: On the header of the page, there is a dropdown which lists all the Business entities defined in organization and provides user the advantage of selecting multiple Business entity at once
2: User can even give keywords and different expressions like John*,~, /Joan_([0-9]+)/ etc to fetch the required results based on requirement
3: User can do a detailed search in attribute level defined for the Business Entities
Hierarchy can be used to link multiple business entities in hierarchical approach.
In customer 360 user can create new hierarchy instances for the defined Hierarchy model in Business 360 console.
All the defined hierarchy models in B360 console are displayed in the Hierarchies tab with the available instances.
Hierarchy instances can be searched using Find box in Hierarchy tab.
Follow the below steps for your understanding:
1. Click on hierarchy tab in the left Navigation menu
2. Click on plus icon next to find box and select the hierarchy model and provide the instance name and click on create button
3. User can create a hierarchy and add root nodes and child nodes and can leave the hierarchy without saving. This will be in draft state until submitted.
4. User can click on show Draft hierarchy and view only the Hierarchies in Draft state.
5. Once changes are made, we can submit the entire hierarchy

patterns: How to run file import job
responses: User can import the loads of records data into the MDM system like Business entities, Relationships and Hierarchies through uploading CSV files from their local system.
Follow the below steps for your understanding:
1. Click on File Import tab in the left Navigation menu
2. Browse csv file from your system and preview of your file will be displayed and user can select source system as well
3: Next step is to map your fields with your target Business entities, Relationships or Hierarchies where you can drag fields from left side of source to right side of target
4. Last step is to preview your changes and can save your mapping as well for future purpose
User is allowed to handle the business event workflows from this screen.
The actions(Create, update, delete, merge and unmerge) that are performed on records of business entity is monitored through this based on the user roles defined in B360 console.
User is allowed to claim and then to approve, reject, send back or release the workflow task based on the requirement.
Follow the below steps for your understanding:
1. Click on Workflow Inbox tab in the left Navigation menu
2. Look for your workflow approval task by checking title, priority, creator and status. you can make use of refresh icon also!
3: Once you have your task ready, you can open it and click on claim button on top right for performing further actions
4. Now you user can edit the record and can do modifications
5. Last step where user can approve, reject, send back or release the workflow task based on the requirement

patterns: How can I check the job status?
responses: My jobs provides over all status of your File import jobs
The job name, link, status and details are available in this screen.
Follow the below steps for your understanding:
1. Click on My jobs tab in the left Navigation menu
2. User could see all the jobs with their start and end time and status
3: User can click on any job and a dashboard will open with all the details
4. There will be 4 Major steps: Transform, Load, Index for Search and Generate tokens
5. User can expand each of these steps and can leverage various parameters such as Overview, Runtime Parameters, Metrics and Error
Reports and Charts gives the data in Graphical representation for the defined outline for a Business Entity
Follow the below steps for your understanding:
1. You can create report by clicking on New icon top right
2. You can view already created reports on Reports tab in the left Navigation menu
3: When creating, user has to provide display name and select its data source
4. Then user can define Dimensions, Measures and Filter according to their need
5. Lastly, we can apply the changes and save the same
Its a Dashboard with different layouts which provides user the feasibility to view the data in required predefined format like graphical representation, pie charts.
Notification icon: located at top right gives License details like expiry will be shown here. All job details like success failure will be shown here. Shoutouts will be shown here.
? icon: This helps you to understand more about Informatica and its products and helps you to connect with customer support
User Name Dropdown: Organization(org) details like Org ID and user name.
User Settings icon: User profile details and Settings for Source Code Control Credentials
